trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Amazon Web Service (AWS) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Amazon Web Service (AWS) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Amazon Web Service (AWS).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Amazon Web Service (AWS).

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Amazon Web Service (AWS)
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Amazon Web Service (AWS)

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate Amazon Web Service (AWS) with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate Amazon Web Service (AWS) with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: Integrating Amazon Web Service (AWS) with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:
trans-unit.target: Integrating Amazon Web Service (AWS) with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:

trans-unit.source: You can control in Azure AD who has access to Amazon Web Service (AWS)
trans-unit.target: You can control in Azure AD who has access to Amazon Web Service (AWS)

trans-unit.source: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to Amazon Web Service (AWS) (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts
trans-unit.target: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to Amazon Web Service (AWS) (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts

trans-unit.source: You can manage your accounts in one central location - the Azure Active Directory Portal
trans-unit.target: You can manage your accounts in one central location - the Azure Active Directory Portal

trans-unit.source: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see [What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see [What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD integration with Amazon Web Service (AWS), you need the following items:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD integration with Amazon Web Service (AWS), you need the following items:

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD subscription
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD subscription

trans-unit.source: An Amazon Web Service (AWS) single-sign on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An Amazon Web Service (AWS) single-sign on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To test the steps in this tutorial, we do not recommend using a production environment.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To test the steps in this tutorial, we do not recommend using a production environment.

trans-unit.source: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:
trans-unit.target: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:

trans-unit.source: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.
trans-unit.target: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure AD trial environment, you can get a one-month trial [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure AD trial environment, you can get a one-month trial [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: Scenario Description
trans-unit.target: Scenario Description

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to enable you to test Azure AD single sign-on in a test environment.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to enable you to test Azure AD single sign-on in a test environment.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of three main building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of three main building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Adding Amazon Web Service (AWS) from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding Amazon Web Service (AWS) from the gallery

trans-unit.source: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Adding Amazon Web Service (AWS) from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding Amazon Web Service (AWS) from the gallery

trans-unit.source: To configure the integration of Amazon Web Service (AWS) into Azure AD, you need to add Amazon Web Service (AWS) from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.
trans-unit.target: To configure the integration of Amazon Web Service (AWS) into Azure AD, you need to add Amazon Web Service (AWS) from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.

trans-unit.source: To add Amazon Web Service (AWS) from the gallery, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add Amazon Web Service (AWS) from the gallery, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: ![Active Directory][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Active Directory][1]

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][2]

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][3]

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][4]

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type **Amazon Web Service (AWS)**.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type **Amazon Web Service (AWS)**.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][5]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][5]

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **Amazon Web Service (AWS)**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **Amazon Web Service (AWS)**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][6]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][6]

trans-unit.source: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to show you how to configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Amazon Web Service (AWS) based on a test user called "Britta Simon".
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to show you how to configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Amazon Web Service (AWS) based on a test user called "Britta Simon".

trans-unit.source: For single sign-on to work, Azure AD needs to know what the counterpart user in Amazon Web Service (AWS) to an user in Azure AD is.
trans-unit.target: For single sign-on to work, Azure AD needs to know what the counterpart user in Amazon Web Service (AWS) to an user in Azure AD is.

trans-unit.source: In other words, a link relationship between an Azure AD user and the related user in Amazon Web Service (AWS) needs to be established.
trans-unit.target: In other words, a link relationship between an Azure AD user and the related user in Amazon Web Service (AWS) needs to be established.

trans-unit.source: This link relationship is established by assigning the value of the **user name** in Azure AD as the value of the **Username** in Amazon Web Service (AWS).
trans-unit.target: This link relationship is established by assigning the value of the **user name** in Azure AD as the value of the **Username** in Amazon Web Service (AWS).

trans-unit.source: To configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Amazon Web Service (AWS), you need to complete the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: To configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Amazon Web Service (AWS), you need to complete the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: **[Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On](#configuring-azure-ad-single-single-sign-on)** - to enable your users to use this feature.
trans-unit.target: **[Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On](#configuring-azure-ad-single-single-sign-on)** - to enable your users to use this feature.

trans-unit.source: **[Creating an Azure AD test user](#creating-an-azure-ad-test-user)** - to test Azure AD single sign-on with Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: **[Creating an Azure AD test user](#creating-an-azure-ad-test-user)** - to test Azure AD single sign-on with Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: **[Creating a Amazon Web Service (AWS) test user](#creating-a-halogen-software-test-user)** - to have a counterpart of Britta Simon in Amazon Web Service (AWS) that is linked to the Azure AD representation of her.
trans-unit.target: **[Creating a Amazon Web Service (AWS) test user](#creating-a-halogen-software-test-user)** - to have a counterpart of Britta Simon in Amazon Web Service (AWS) that is linked to the Azure AD representation of her.

trans-unit.source: **[Assigning the Azure AD test user](#assigning-the-azure-ad-test-user)** - to enable Britta Simon to use Azure AD single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: **[Assigning the Azure AD test user](#assigning-the-azure-ad-test-user)** - to enable Britta Simon to use Azure AD single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: **[Testing Single Sign-On](#testing-single-sign-on)** - to verify whether the configuration works.
trans-unit.target: **[Testing Single Sign-On](#testing-single-sign-on)** - to verify whether the configuration works.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to enable Azure AD single sign-on in the Azure AD portal and to configure single sign-on in your Amazon Web Service (AWS) application.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to enable Azure AD single sign-on in the Azure AD portal and to configure single sign-on in your Amazon Web Service (AWS) application.

trans-unit.source: Your Amazon Web Service (AWS) application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your **saml token attributes** configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your Amazon Web Service (AWS) application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your **saml token attributes** configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][27]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][27]

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with Amazon Web Service (AWS), perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with Amazon Web Service (AWS), perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Amazon Web Service (AWS)** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign-On** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Amazon Web Service (AWS)** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign-On** dialog.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][7]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][7]

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Amazon Web Service (AWS)** page, select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Amazon Web Service (AWS)** page, select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][8]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][8]

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App Settings** dialog page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App Settings** dialog page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure App Settings][9]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure App Settings][9]

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at Amazon Web Service (AWS)** page, click **Download metadata**, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at Amazon Web Service (AWS)** page, click **Download metadata**, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][10]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][10]

trans-unit.source: In a different browser window, sign-on to your Amazon Web Service (AWS) company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different browser window, sign-on to your Amazon Web Service (AWS) company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click **Console Home**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Console Home**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][11]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][11]

trans-unit.source: Click **Identity and Access Management**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Identity and Access Management**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][12]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][12]

trans-unit.source: Click **Identity Providers**, and then click **Create Provider**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Identity Providers**, and then click **Create Provider**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][13]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][13]

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure Provider** dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure Provider** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][14]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][14]

trans-unit.source: As **Provider Type**, select **SAML**.
trans-unit.target: As **Provider Type**, select **SAML**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Provider Name** textbox, type a provider name (e.g.: *WAAD*).
trans-unit.target: In the **Provider Name** textbox, type a provider name (e.g.: *WAAD*).

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded metadata file, click **Choose File**.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded metadata file, click **Choose File**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next Step**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next Step**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Verify Provider Information** dialog page, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Verify Provider Information** dialog page, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][15]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][15]

trans-unit.source: Go to **Roles > Create New Role**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Roles > Create New Role**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][16]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][16]

trans-unit.source: On the **Set Role Name** dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Set Role Name** dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][17]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][17]

trans-unit.source: In the **Role Name** textbox, type a role name (e.g.: *TestUser*).
trans-unit.target: In the **Role Name** textbox, type a role name (e.g.: *TestUser*).

trans-unit.source: Click **Next Step**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next Step**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Select Role Type** dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Select Role Type** dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][18]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][18]

trans-unit.source: Select **Role For Identity Provider Access**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Role For Identity Provider Access**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Grant Web Single Sign-On (WebSSO) access to SAML providers** section, click **Select**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Grant Web Single Sign-On (WebSSO) access to SAML providers** section, click **Select**.

trans-unit.source: On the Establish Trust dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Establish Trust dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][19]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][19]

trans-unit.source: As SAML provider, select the SAML provider you have created previousley (e.g.: *WAAD*)
trans-unit.target: As SAML provider, select the SAML provider you have created previousley (e.g.: *WAAD*)

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: ![What is Azure AD Connect][20]
trans-unit.target: ![What is Azure AD Connect][20]

trans-unit.source: On the **Single sign-on confirmation** page, click **Complete** to close the **Configure single sign-on** dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the **Single sign-on confirmation** page, click **Complete** to close the **Configure single sign-on** dialog.

trans-unit.source: ![What is Azure AD Connect][22]
trans-unit.target: ![What is Azure AD Connect][22]

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click **Attributes** to open the **SAML Token Attributes** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click **Attributes** to open the **SAML Token Attributes** dialog.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][21]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][21]

trans-unit.source: Click **add user attribute**.
trans-unit.target: Click **add user attribute**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][23]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][23]

trans-unit.source: On the Add User Attribute dialog, perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: On the Add User Attribute dialog, perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][24]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][24]

trans-unit.source: In the **Attribute Name** textbox, type **https://aws.amazon.com/SAML/Attributes/Role**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Attribute Name** textbox, type **https://aws.amazon.com/SAML/Attributes/Role**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Attribute Value** textbox, type **arn:aws:iam::214510765665:role/Admin,arn:aws:iam::214510765665:saml-provider/WAAD**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Attribute Value** textbox, type **arn:aws:iam::214510765665:role/Admin,arn:aws:iam::214510765665:saml-provider/WAAD**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Complete** to close the **Add User Attribute** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **Complete** to close the **Add User Attribute** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click **add user attribute**.
trans-unit.target: Click **add user attribute**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][23]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][23]

trans-unit.source: On the Add User Attribute dialog, perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: On the Add User Attribute dialog, perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][25]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][25]

trans-unit.source: In the **Attribute Name** textbox, type **https://aws.amazon.com/SAML/Attributes/RoleSessionName**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Attribute Name** textbox, type **https://aws.amazon.com/SAML/Attributes/RoleSessionName**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Attribute Value** list, select **user:mail**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Attribute Value** list, select **user:mail**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Complete** to close the **Add User Attribute** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **Complete** to close the **Add User Attribute** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click **Apply Changes**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Apply Changes**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][26]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][26]

trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to create a test user in the Azure portal called Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to create a test user in the Azure portal called Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the Users list, select **Britta Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the Users list, select **Britta Simon**.

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_01.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_01.png)

trans-unit.source: To create a test user in Azure AD, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a test user in Azure AD, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_02.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_02.png)

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To display the list of users, in the menu on the top, click **Users**.
trans-unit.target: To display the list of users, in the menu on the top, click **Users**.

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_03.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_03.png)

trans-unit.source: To open the **Add User** dialog, in the toolbar on the bottom, click **Add User**.
trans-unit.target: To open the **Add User** dialog, in the toolbar on the bottom, click **Add User**.

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_04.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_04.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Tell us about this user** dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Tell us about this user** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_05.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_05.png)

trans-unit.source: As Type Of User, select New user in your organization.
trans-unit.target: As Type Of User, select New user in your organization.

trans-unit.source: In the User Name **textbox**, type **BrittaSimon**.
trans-unit.target: In the User Name **textbox**, type **BrittaSimon**.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the **User Profile** dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **User Profile** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_06.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_06.png)

trans-unit.source: In the **First Name** textbox, type **Britta**.
trans-unit.target: In the **First Name** textbox, type **Britta**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Last Name** txtbox, type, **Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Last Name** txtbox, type, **Simon**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Display Name** textbox, type **Britta Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Display Name** textbox, type **Britta Simon**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Role** list, select **User**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Role** list, select **User**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Get temporary password** dialog page, click **create**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Get temporary password** dialog page, click **create**.

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_07.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_07.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Get temporary password** dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Get temporary password** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_08.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-amazon-web-service/create_aaduser_08.png)

trans-unit.source: Write down the value of the **New Password**.
trans-unit.target: Write down the value of the **New Password**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Complete**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Complete**.

trans-unit.source: Creating a Amazon Web Service (AWS) test user
trans-unit.target: Creating a Amazon Web Service (AWS) test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to create a user called Britta Simon in Amazon Web Service (AWS).
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to create a user called Britta Simon in Amazon Web Service (AWS).

trans-unit.source: To create a user called Britta Simon in Amazon Web Service (AWS), perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a user called Britta Simon in Amazon Web Service (AWS), perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your **Amazon Web Service (AWS)** company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your **Amazon Web Service (AWS)** company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Console Home** icon.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Console Home** icon.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][11]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][11]

trans-unit.source: Click Identity and Access Management.
trans-unit.target: Click Identity and Access Management.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][28]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][28]

trans-unit.source: In the Dashboard, click Users, and then click Create New Users.
trans-unit.target: In the Dashboard, click Users, and then click Create New Users.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][29]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][29]

trans-unit.source: On the Create User dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Create User dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][30]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][30]

trans-unit.source: In the **Enter User Names** textboxes, type Brita Simon's user name in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: In the **Enter User Names** textboxes, type Brita Simon's user name in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Assigning the Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: Assigning the Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to enabling Britta Simon to use Azure single sign-on by granting her access to Amazon Web Service (AWS).
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to enabling Britta Simon to use Azure single sign-on by granting her access to Amazon Web Service (AWS).

trans-unit.source: ![Assign User][31]
trans-unit.target: ![Assign User][31]

trans-unit.source: To assign Britta Simon to CloudPassage, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign Britta Simon to CloudPassage, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: On the Azure portal, to open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure portal, to open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: ![Assign User][26]
trans-unit.target: ![Assign User][26]

trans-unit.source: In the applications list, select **Amazon Web Service (AWS)**.
trans-unit.target: In the applications list, select **Amazon Web Service (AWS)**.

trans-unit.source: ![Assign User][27]
trans-unit.target: ![Assign User][27]

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click **Users**.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click **Users**.

trans-unit.source: ![Assign User][25]
trans-unit.target: ![Assign User][25]

trans-unit.source: In the Users list, select **Britta Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the Users list, select **Britta Simon**.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the bottom, click **Assign**.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the bottom, click **Assign**.

trans-unit.source: ![Assign User][29]
trans-unit.target: ![Assign User][29]

trans-unit.source: Testing Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Testing Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to test your Azure AD single sign-on configuration using the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to test your Azure AD single sign-on configuration using the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: When you click the Amazon Web Service (AWS) tile in the Access Panel, you should get automatically signed-on to your Amazon Web Service (AWS) application.
trans-unit.target: When you click the Amazon Web Service (AWS) tile in the Access Panel, you should get automatically signed-on to your Amazon Web Service (AWS) application.
